description: MobX store classes managing employee status, clock-in/out tracking, and PIN management with optimized caching

components.EmployeeStatusStore: High-performance MobX store managing employee clock-in/out status and PIN setup tracking with 1-minute cache TTL.

rules: Ultra-short 1-minute cache TTL optimized for real-time employee clock status accuracy and workforce management.
Batch loading optimization using Future.wait for parallel employee status loading reducing database query overhead.
ObservableMap integration for clock statuses and PIN statuses enabling reactive UI updates across employee interfaces.
Clock-in order tracking with ClockInEntry list maintaining chronological employee arrival order for shift management.
TimeTrackingService integration for centralized time tracking operations and clock-in/out workflow management.
Error handling with fallback to safe states (clocked out, no PIN) preventing UI inconsistencies during service failures.
Smart caching system checking cache TTL before performing expensive batch loading operations.
Force refresh capability bypassing cache for immediate status updates when data accuracy is critical.
Individual employee status refresh for targeted updates without reloading entire employee workforce.
Today's clock-in order computation filtering entries to current day with proper date comparison logic.
PIN status tracking based on employee PIN hash existence for authentication and security management.
Parallel status loading with error isolation ensuring single employee failures don't affect batch operations.
Real-time status updates through updateEmployeeClockStatus maintaining UI synchronization with backend state.
Clock-in order management with automatic sorting by arrival time for proper shift scheduling display.
Professional error logging with structured information for debugging and operational monitoring.
Cache invalidation methods supporting manual data refresh and forced status synchronization.
MobX reactive patterns with computed properties for derived state calculations like today's clock-in order.
Batch update patterns minimizing reactive notifications and improving performance with large employee lists.
Date utility methods for same-day comparison supporting clock-in order filtering and time-based operations.
Comprehensive workforce management supporting real-time employee availability and scheduling coordination.
